moves.4. b3 c5 5. Bd2 Nc6: White thrusts forward his Pawns, while I focus on piece development.
moves.10. Bg5 h6 11. Be3 d4: I fork two pieces. I was expecting 12 NxP PxN 13 BxQP, but White surprised me with a sacrifce to open my King's position up.
moves.12. Bxh6 gxh6 13. Na4 Nh7: After accepting the sacrifice, I want to clear space around my King to avoid getting trapped.
moves.14. Qd2 f6 15. Qxh6 Qe7: I have to focus on defense.
moves.16. Nh4 Qg7 17. Qxg7+ Kxg7: With the Queens gone, the chance of a sudden mate is lessened considerably. I would still like to move my King closer to his friends, though.
moves.18. a3 Ng5 19. Nb2 Nd8: I am trying to shift my pieces to the K-side to block White's potential Pawn advance.
moves.20. Bxb7 Nxb7 21. a4 a5: Cutting him off at the pass on the Q-side.
moves.22. f4 Nf7 23. Rae1 e5: I was expecting 24 PxP PxP, opening a line and giving White connected passed Pawns, but was surprised when he closed the position instead.
moves.24. f5 Nh8 25. g4 Kf7: Time for the King to get in the safe zone.
moves.26. e4 Ke7 27. h3 Kd7: Mission accomplished. Now the hard part: blocking White on the KR and KN files.
moves.30. Kg3 Rg7 31. Nf3 Nf7: ...opening a lane for the other Rook...
moves.32. h4 Rh8 33. h5 Rgh7: ...and the KR file is cut off, One more thing to do...
moves.36. Nd2 Ng5 37. Nb1 Nd6: This Knight guards the one potential Q-side entry at my QN4.

gameName: League division D3 -- hard fought draw
